item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 26, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Hard numbers in the Wayland vs. X11 input latency discussion (157 points | 64 comments)
2. Reviving a Dead Audio Format: The Return of ZZM (24 points | 1 comment)
3. Render raises $80M in Series C financing (7 points | 1 comment)
4. It's not a crime if we do it with an app (619 points | 388 comments)
5. The Protesters' Guide to Smartphone Security (107 points | 34 comments)
6. Steam Brick: No screen, no controller, just a power button and a USB port (736 points | 214 comments)
7. No Bitcoin ETFs at Vanguard? Here's why (205 points | 237 comments)
8. DeepSeek-R1: Incentivizing Reasoning Capability in LLMs via RL (1048 points | 891 comments)
9. Paxo: A DIY Phone (90 points | 23 comments)
10. 100 years of Bell Labs [pdf] (10 points | 1 comment)
11. Two F-14 fighter jets were diverted to USS Midway (13 points | 10 comments)
12. OpenRA – Classic strategy games rebuilt for the modern era (541 points | 99 comments)
13. YC Graveyard: 821 inactive Y Combinator startups (286 points | 170 comments)
14. I Built an Omni-Directional Ball-Wheeled Bike [video] (56 points | 8 comments)
15. AI slop, suspicion, and writing back (156 points | 123 comments)
16. Explainer: What's R1 and Everything Else? (183 points | 80 comments)
17. The South Vietnamese pilot who landed a Cessna on a carrier to save his family (2019) (295 points | 146 comments)
18. Every HTML Element (408 points | 119 comments)
19. Are Americans' perceptions of the economy and crime broken? (23 points | 31 comments)
20. An invalid 68030 instruction accidentally allowed the Mac Classic II to boot (269 points | 49 comments)
21. Microsoft 365 Copilot launch was a total disaster (136 points | 125 comments)
22. Apache Iceberg (158 points | 50 comments)
23. SigNoz (YC W21) Is hiring back end engineers to build open-source Datadog ( | hide)
24. The Simplicity of Prolog (142 points | 63 comments)
25. Using the most unhinged AVX-512 instruction to make fastest phrase search algo (11 points | 1 comment)
26. SQLook – A free online SQLite database manager with a Windows 2000 interface (163 points | 58 comments)
27. The Hunt for Error -22 (44 points | 13 comments)
28. The Graphics Codex (53 points | 14 comments)
29. Austin rents have fallen for nearly two years. Here's why (10 points | 2 comments)
30. Searching for DeepSeek's glitch tokens (184 points | 40 comments)
